name: To Which Song Do I Belong? Quiz | Which Song Is It | 10 Questions

questions.text:
An easy one to get you off to a flying start.-

"Mama, just killed a man 
Put a gun against his head
Pulled the trigger now he's dead."

A classic from Queen, but which one?
questions.explanation:
Bohemian Rhapsody.

	"Bohemian Rhapsody" is consistently voted #1 in listeners' and readers' all-time favourite charts in the UK [The only other competitor is "John Lennon's- Imagine"]. Queen's flambouant frontman Freddie Mercury, who tragically died in 1991, was probably pop music's greatest showman. "Queen's Greatest Hits" album has topped 25 million worldwide sales, and is still going strong. The group was inducted into the "Rock and Roll Hall of Fame" in the year 2000.

questions.text:
Abba sang these risque words-

"You're a teaser, you turn 'em on 
Leave them burning and then you're gone 
Looking out for another, anyone will do 
You're in the mood for a dance 
And when you get the chance..."

Can you match them to the song?
questions.explanation:
Dancing Queen.

	Abba sprang to fame after winning the 1974 "Eurovision Song Contest" held in Brighton, England. The Swedish group went on to dominate the UK charts for 20 years. They also hit the top in the USA with "Dancing Queen" in 1976. Abba's music became the theme of the hit West-End musical "Mamma Mia".

questions.text:
Here's a familiar lyric from the Eagles.-

"There's talk on the street, it sounds so familiar 
Great expectations, everybody's watching you 
People you meet they all seem to know you 
Even your old friends treat you like you're something new."

To which of these songs do these words belong?
questions.explanation:
New Kid in Town.

	The Eagles were formed in 1971. They had a successful run of records and tours, in both the US and UK, until they went their separate ways in 1981. The Eagles reunited in 1994 and were inducted into the "Rock and Roll Hall of Fame" in 1998.

questions.text:
"What'll you do when you get lonely 
And nobody's waiting by your side? 
You've been running and hiding much too long. 
You know it's just your foolish pride."-

Familiar lyrics, but in which Eric Clapton song do they feature?
questions.explanation:
Layla.

	Known as a "musician's musician", Clapton has been the driving force behind several influentual bands, The Yardbirds, Cream, Blind Faith and Derek and the Dominoes. His musical talent for writing, playing and singing knows no bounds.

questions.text:
This one's from the "Big O" - Roy Orbison.-

"I feel so bad I've got a worried mind
I'm so lonesome all the time
Since I left my baby behind..."

To which of these Roy Orbison classics do these lyrics relate?
questions.explanation:
Blue Bayou.

	Roy's distinctive vocal style gave him a consistant run of hits throughout the sixties. "Big O", as he was known, hit upon a successful formula of heart-rending-lost-love songs, and stuck with it. Roy died in 1988. His trophies included; Grammy, Songwriters, and Rock and Roll, 'Hall of Fame' awards.

questions.text:
These rather cryptic lyrics form part of which Beatles song?

"There's nothing you can do that can't be done.
Nothing you can sing that can't be sung.
Nothing you can say, but you can learn
How to play the game - It's easy."
questions.explanation:
All You Need is Love.

	The songwriting talents of John Lennon and Paul McCartney propelled the Beatles to dizzy heights never before - nor since -attained by any band. Their 1967 "Sgt. Pepper" album took pop music beyond the realm of bland love songs and into a new dimension. The band went their separate ways in 1970, Lennon formed The Plastic Ono Band and had solo success.McCartney formed Wings, and George Harrison also had much solo acclaim . It is estimated that the Beatles world-wide sales exceed one billion records. It was always hoped, and often rumoured, that the Beatles would reform. But the murder of John Lennon in 1980, and the more recent death of George Harrison, put an end to that speculation - although their music will live forever.

questions.text:
Tina Turner gave a soulful rendition of these lyrics-

"Better than anyone, anyone I've ever met 
I'm stuck on your heart, and hang on every word you say 
Tear us apart, baby I would rather be dead."

-in which song?
options: What's Love Got to do with It
questions.explanation:
The Best.

	Tina was born Anna May Bullock in 1939. She began singing with her husband as Ike and Tina Turner. Their first major success was in 1966 with the classic Phil Spector production "River Deep and Mountain High". A turbulent relationship led to Tina's seperation from Ike. She then pursued of a solo career. Her unique blend of rock and soul has seen Tina's popularity maintained into the new millenium.

questions.text:
These words were sung by The Bee Gees-

"Here I am
Prayin' for this moment to last
Livin' on the music so fine
Borne on the wind
Makin' it mine."

But to which song do the words belong?
questions.explanation:
Night Fever.

	The Gibb brothers, Barry, Robin and Maurice formed the Bee Gees in the mid-sixties. Born in the UK they were raised in Australia. With record sales in excess of 100 million they are the world's most successful family pop act. The Bee Gees received the "World Music Legend Award" in 1977.

questions.text:
Andy Williams has recorded many great songs, which one are these lyrics from?

"Guys talk girl talk, it happens everywhere 
Eyes watch girls walk with tender lovin' care."
options: Can't Take My Eyes Off  You
questions.explanation:
Music to Watch Girls By.

	Andy Williams has been making hit records for five decades. He started his showbiz life with the Williams Brothers. Andy left the brothers in 1951 to carve out a solo career. He also had success hosting his own TV shows.

questions.text:
"When you're weary, feeling small 
When tears are in your eyes, I will dry them all 
I'm on your side, oh, when times get rough 
And friends just can't be found."

Which Simon and Garfunkel classic do these words come from?
questions.explanation:
Bridge Over Troubled Water.

	Paul Simon and Art Garfunkel teamed-up as a duo in the late 1950s. They had some initial success in the US under the name of Tom and Jerry. After a change of name they had a string of hits from the mid-sixties through to the early seventies. Both went on to have accomplished solo careers.
